Key Match Events: Glenn Phillips c Rabada b Coetzee 60 (50b 4x4 4x6 87m) SR: 120
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa still don't look convincing
Both teams are in the top three at this stage, and the winners of this game will feel very secure about their future
Shashank Kishore: Two outstanding teams, one grand spectacle in store in Pune
Post-Match Reflections: Van der Dussen: 'We're blessed that we're in a great space now'
Latham: 'Focusing on the things that we do well'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Conway has been dismissed twice in six games by left-arm spin at this World Cup
South Africa have Maharaj in the mix
Ravindra's tally of 406 runs is already the most by a New Zealander in his maiden World Cup
South Africa's seven 300-plus totals in a row batting first in ODIs - including four this World Cup - is the longest streak in the game
Others: Kagiso Rabada missed the previous game because of a niggle, but is understood to be fit and is expected to return to the XI
Gerald Coetzee and Tabraiz Shamsi both had important roles to play in their win over Pakistan in Chennai, but one of them will probably have to make way, depending on the pitch
